Document Sources.Sourced Statement: According to the Board of Registered Nursing, 92 out of 152 publicly funded nursing programs were denied access to clinic placements.
Document Sources.Source Justification: The Board of Registered Nursing is cited as the source for data on nursing program denials for clinical placements.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Sen. Cortese said that SB 1015 ensures that the state meets the growing demand in the nursing field.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Sen. Cortese is the author of SB 1015 and provides insight into the bill's purpose and impact.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “As California’s population ages and becomes increasingly more diverse, we will need a qualified and experienced nursing workforce to meet the unique demands and varied needs of all patients. That is why we must have appropriate nurse staffing levels which have proven to reduce mortality rates, reduce hospital length of stays, and reduce the number of preventable events such as falls and infections,” said Cortese.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Sen. Cortese elaborates on the necessity of SB 1015 to address the nursing workforce needs in California.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Cathy Kennedy, a Registered Nurse and president of the CNA, said that SB 1015 helps nursing students receive a clinical education and placement amid the nationwide staffing crisis, despite their socioeconomic background.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Registered Nurse and President of the CNA
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Cathy Kennedy, as the president of the California Nurses Association, provides perspective on the importance of SB 1015 for nursing students.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “Clinical education is an essential part of any nurse’s education, yet aspiring nurses, especially students in public programs, are being denied access to clinical placements,” said Kennedy.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Registered Nurse and President of the CNA
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Cathy Kennedy highlights the challenges faced by nursing students in securing clinical placements.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “We applaud the California Senate for passing S.B. 1015. It is commonsense reform that will increase transparency and increase oversight from the Board of Registered Nursing,” she added.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Registered Nurse and President of the CNA
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Cathy Kennedy expresses support for SB 1015 and its potential impact on nursing education and oversight.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The California Nurses Association (CNA), the largest union of registered nurses in the state, sponsored SB 1015 to support nursing students seeking placement in the workforce.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: The California Nurses Association is identified as the sponsor of SB 1015, supporting nursing students in securing workforce placements.
